result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael D. Dombrowski was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
No jail credit.

timeConds.notes: with huber, 1/2 may be served on electronic monitor, if eligible. To begin within 60 days.

Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Michael D. Dombrowski in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. (.22% Reading) Count 1 OWI 4th w/minor passenger: W/H Sentence: 30 mo Probation: 360 days jail, $1,800 fine + cost, $26.45 blood draw costs, 36 mo revocation, 36 mo IID, AODA/DOT Safety. Count 2 to be dismissed.  Request for PSI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1: Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.  Count 2 is Dismissed.
Atty Schmitt states the Defendant is ready to be sentenced today.
ADA Cousins states no PSI is requested and makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmitt makes sentencing arguments to the Court and request 9 mo jail and report up to 60 days and IID to be effective immediately. 

BY THE COURT: ***************Probation**********

Count 1 OWI 4th w/minor passenger: I/S Sentence.  1 yr jail - stayed
 30 mo Probation: 
180 days jail,  with huber, 1/2 serve electronic monitor option. To begin within 60 days.
$1,800 fine + cost, 
$26.45 blood draw costs 
36 mo revocation 
36 mo IID, 
AODA/DOT Safety
Conditions: 
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
No jail credit
